716579f.text:
Battery Place, north side, east from Washington, to and including Greenwich Streets. Also sbown is Washington Street, east side, north from
Battery Place, to, but not including Morris Street.
About 1910.
716579f.folder: Battery Place & Washington Street, Manhattan, NY

724051f-a.text:
WWashington Street, north from a point between Battery Place a-d Morris Street (seen in the foreground) and showing a view northeastward across Manhattan Svrian sector as viewed frorn the Whitehall Bldg. In e foremround apnears a portion of the steel frame work of the Downtown Athletic Club. Shortly the adjacent rookeries will surplanted by the United Frnit Co. Bldg. In the center and to the left of the Singer Tower is the 23 storied Electric Bond and Share Bldg. at Rector Street.
June 20, 1929.
P.L. Sperr
724051f-a.folder: Washington Street & Battery Place, Manhattan, NY

724054f.text:
Washington Street, west side, north from Battery Place to Morris Street, as seen across Battery Park. On the left, is the Whitehall Building (No. 1-14 West Street). Building bearing flag, is the Downtown Athletic
Club (No. 18 West Street).
About 1931.
Ewing Galloway.
724054f.folder: Washington Street & Battery Place, Manhattan, NY

724053f.text:
Washington Street, west side, north from, but not including Battery Place, to and including Morris Street. Buildings shown face onto West Street, and are from left to right, the Whitehall Building (No. 1-14), the Downtown Athletic Club (No. 18), and No. 21 respectively. The background
shows piers and wharfs abuting onto the Hudson River.
About 1931.
Ewing Galloway.

716578f-b.text:
Battery Place, north side, east from Washington (left) to Greenwich Streets (right). Note the Battery Place station of the Sixth and Ninth Aves. Elevated Lines on Greenwich Street. The only building of this row that bears a Battery Place number (No. 5) is the 4-story, center structure; the corner buildings being (left) No. 17iWashington Street, a 3-story, and No. 2 Greenwich Street, a 4-story affair. Shbwn on the left; on Washington Street, are Nos. 17, 3-5, 7 and 9, at, adjoining
and north of the N.E. corner of Battery Place.
April 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(2)
A closer view, showing in the foreground the N.E. corner of Washington
Street and Battery Place.
April 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
716578f-b.folder: Battery Place & Washington Street, Manhattan, NY
